TextView.android:text: 1. Instead of using screens as the place to go when you’re bored (as many teens tend to do), find a hobby that interests you. It could be making jewelry, gardening, or just curling up with a good book. Train your brain to realize that it doesn’t need screens to be entertained.

2. Work first. Then Snapchat. Many teens think they multitask and can stay focused on their homework while chatting with their friends. However, we normally get distracted from our work and focus on our Instagram feed, or what our friends just Snapchatted us. We unwittingly spend unnecessary hours on screens using social media instead of working. If we just did our homework first, we’d get it done in half the time and then could still have time to use social media without our parents yelling at us.

3. Get Active. Instead of lying on your couch staring at your phone, get outside and exercise. Studies have linked over usage of screens to obesity and worse. Too much exposure to screens can also lead to various eye conditions, such as computer vision syndrome
